title: WCAS HISTORY 392-0-24 Topics In History
topic: Film and History: Postwar Japan and Post-Mao China

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Post-war Japanese films (from the samurai films of Kurosawa to Beat Takeshi and Miyazaki) and Chinese films after the Cultural Revolution to today (including those by Zhang Yimou, Chen Kaige, Ang Lee, Wong Kar-wai, and Jia Zhangke) are classic works of art, box-office hits, and global business. This course explores what they also say about history, national identity, how society and family work, and personal experience.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: PREREQUISITES: Any course in film studies or Asian history or permission of instructor

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Watching films in and outside of class, lectures, discussion, reaction papers, final essay.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Watching films, discussion, reaction papers, final essay.
